etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Frederic William Maitland (1850–1906), legal historian. From parentel- + -ic

definitions: Of or relating to kinship or relation based on common ancestry; (Law) designating a system for determining next of kin and their shares of an estate.

notes.text: "parentelic scheme" noun Law a system of succession under which heirs are sought among surviving members, first of the deceased's parentela, then of the deceased's parents' parentela, then of the grandparents, and so on.
